column3: description

The active class is applied to the navigation element the user is currently viewing. In the case of your code, the user is viewing the profile. It will serve as a guide or reminder to where in the website the visitor is in. That is why the active class is applied, which comes handy when viewing a website with many navigation links.

The active class is applied to the navigation element the user is currently viewing. In the case of your code, the user is viewing the profile. It will serve as a guide or reminder to where in the website the visitor is in. That is why the active class is applied, which comes handy when viewing a website with many navigation links.
Adds a blue background color to the active list item in a list group
Adds a blue background color to simulate a "pressed" button
Animates a striped progress bar
Adds a blue background color to the active dropdown item in a dropdown
Adds a blue background color to the active pagination link (to highlight the current page)
The affix plugin toggles position: fixed; on and off, emulating the effect found with position: sticky;. The sub navigation on the right is a live demo of the affix plugin.

Provide contextual feedback messages for typical user actions with the handful of available and flexible alert messages. Alerts are available for any length of text, as well as an optional dismiss button.
alert-danger class is red alert box Indicates a dangerous or potentially negative action. Add the class .alert-danger to the .alert base class to create error or danger alerts.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin. Defaults as red background color.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin. Defaults as blue background color.
When you add links inside alert this class matches the font color to the parent alert class.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin. Defaults as green background color.
Similar to a well it is a box with a border and padding. The .alert class adds the padding and margin. Defaults as yellow background color.
initial avatar class. This class includes all the features like avatar font size, alignment. The default size of this avatar is 32px
Avatar class for 16 px. Commonly used to display number of users  invoved in an activity
Avatar class of 24px. This size is  used to display subscriptions in navigaton or active users
Standard Avatar size for navbar or navmenu
Avatar class for 48 px. Best used in media object and list
Avatar class for 64 px. Can be used in media object or profile page
An alternate avatar size for navbar dropdown (gmail) for almost 100px
standard avatar size for profile page
.b is border class, Border option provides the ability to sectionize a content and display in better way. Here .b provides border for all sides.
.b-0 is no border class, it does not provide a border, the class .b-0 will remove all the borders.
.bt is a border class, which only provides border on top. bt stands for border top.
.bt-0 in no border class, it removes top border.
.br class will give only right side border.
.br-0 class will remove only right side border
.bb class will give only border only in bottom.
.bb-0 class will remove only bottom border.
.bl class will work with left side border.
.bl-0 class will remove only left side border.
Button for file input
.btn-circle class is used to make the buttons in circle shape.
.btn-rounded class will convert the left and right edges in rounded shape.
.btn-outline class is used to make the buttons with outline.
This class includes the basic configuration required to set a background cover image on a selected element. You just need to define background-image CSS property along with this class.
jumbotron Background color, .bg-jumbotron class is used to make the background color in light gray(jumbotron color).
Make background transparent. Its a utility that can be used on list groups, tabs, panel heading.
.bg-well class is used to make the background color in well color.
.br-white will make the background color to white.
Used to show new or unread messages or items like the iOS red icon showing new messages or email.

Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes. It adds a orange background color to an element.

Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes. It adds a light-blue background color to an element. Represents some information

Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes. It adds a blue background color to an element.

Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes. It adds a green background color to an element. Which indicates success or a positive action.

Similar to the contextual text color classes, easily set the background of an element to any contextual class. Anchor components will darken on hover, just like the text classes. It adds a yellow background color to an element.
A pagination. Indicates the current pages location within a navigational hierarchy
This class creates a basic button (gray background and rounded corners) and also sets the spacing and size of the button.
Creates a block level button that spans the entire width of the parent element.
Creates a block level button that spans the entire width of the parent element in mobile screens.
It defaults to a red background button. Which Indicates danger or a negative action.
It defaults to a white background button with dark gray border.
Smushes multiple buttons together to make a pill shape. Each button is separated by a vertical line.
Smushes multiple buttons together to make a pill shape. Each button is separated by a vertical line. This class is specially designed to create a toolbar for editor plugins
Make a group of buttons stretch at equal sizes to span the entire width of its parent. Also works with button dropdowns within the button group.
Large button group (makes all buttons in a button group larger - increased font-size and padding)
Small button group (makes all buttons in a button group smaller)
Extra small button group (makes all buttons in a button group extra small)
Make a set of buttons appear vertically stacked rather than horizontally.
Button for information on a topic like terms and conditions. Default color is light blue.
Keeps the spacing set with the .btn class but removes the outer border. Makes a button look like a link (get button behavior)
Fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add .btn-lg, .btn-sm, or .btn-xs for additional sizes.
Use for the primary action in a set. Which indicates with Blue color button.
btn-sm is a fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add .btn-lg, .btn-sm, or .btn-xs for additional sizes.
btn-success by defaults to a green background button with dark border. Which represents positive action.
By defaults btn-warning is to a yellow background button with dark border. Which represents warning or a negative action.
btn-xs is a fancy larger or smaller buttons? Add .btn-lg, .btn-sm, or .btn-xs for additional sizes. xs indicates Extra small button.
Adds a caption text inside a thumbnail, but could be used elsewhere.
Caret class creates a  arrow icon , Used in dropdown menus to show open and closed states.
Parent carousel class making it position relative, which creates a carousel (slideshow).
It creates a caption text for each slide item in the carousel.
Container which is added to each next and previous anchors.
Adds little dots/indicators at the bottom of each slide (which indicates how many slides there is in the carousel, and which slide the user are currently viewing)
It is a div wrapper that contains the carousel slide items.
Centers any element (Sets an element to display:block with margin-right:auto and margin-left:auto)
Form checkbox wrapper - Checkboxes are for selecting one or several options in a list, while radios are for selecting one option from many.
Checkboxes are for selecting one or several options in a list, while radios are for selecting one option from many.
Used to clear floats by adding .cleafix to the parent element. It adds a pseudo element with clear:both property.
Use the generic close icon for dismissing content like modals and alerts.

Responsive grid (span 1-12 column). Extra small devices Phones (< 768px), Small devices Tablets (≥768px), Medium devices Desktops (≥992px), Large devices Desktops (≥1200px). Column values can be 1-12.
Move columns to the right. These classes increase the left margin of a column by * columns
Changes the order of the grid columns
Changes the order of the grid columns
Indicates collapsible content - which can be hidden or shown on demand
Show the collapsible content by default
Fixed width container with widths determined by screen sites. Equal margin on the left and right.
A container that spans the full width of the screen
Uses display flex. This was created to adjust the footer link of panel as per text in grid system. Flex is not supported for Internet Explorer Browser
Simple Login Container
2 Column Login container for Descriptive text or social login
Container size of 970px
Container size of 750px
prevent container size jumping at media query breakpoints

Displays grid as table, table-row and table-cell. It was specifically designed to center align-content. The limition of this grid is that you cannot to total xolumsize of more than 12. It is good to use with row split of full page height Content
Container size of 480px
In forms this classes is added to form labels to allow the label to be used for form validation.
Adds a red background to the table row (<tr> or table cell (<td>). Indicates a dangerous or potentially negative action
Disables a button (adds opacity and a "no-parking-sign" icon on hover)
Disables a dropdown item (adds a grey text color and a "no-parking-sign" icon on hover)
Disables a pagination link (cannot be clicked - adds a grey text color and a "no-parking-sign" icon on hover)
Disables a list item in a list group (cannot be clicked - adds a grey background color and a "no-parking-sign" icon on hover)
Disables a navigation item in Tabs or pill (cannot be clicked - adds a grey background color and a "no-parking-sign" icon on hover)
Used to separate links in the dropdown menu with a thin horizontal border
Lines up the terms <dt> and descriptions <dd> in <dl> elements side-by-side. Starts off like default <dl>s, but when the browser window expands, it will line up side-by-side
This class gives you the ability to add a dropdown to navbar, tabs, and pills so you can display a dropdown of additional navigation.
Used to add headers inside the dropdown menu
Adds the default styles for the dropdown menu container
Right-aligns a dropdown menu
Create a submenu for a dropdown menu
Used on the button that should hide and show (toggle) the dropdown menu
Indicates a dropup menu (upwards instead of downwards)
Container for embedded content. Makes videos or slideshows scale properly on any device
Container for embedded content. Creates an 16:9 aspect ratio embedded content
Container for embedded content. Creates an 4:3 aspect ratio embedded content
Used inside .embed-responsive. Scales the video nicely to the parent element
Adds a fading effect when closing an alert box
Used on input, textarea, and select elements to span the entire width of the page and make them responsive
A form validation class.
Lets you add plain text to the right of a label. For example, Email label could have help text.
Container for form input and label
Makes a <form> left-aligned with inline-block controls (This only applies to forms within viewports that are at least 768px wide)
Aligns labels and groups of form controls in a horizontal layout
Justifies the gutter width in left and right
Removes gutter from grid
Applies 5 pixel gutter on grid
Applies 10 pixel gutter on grid
Applies 15 pixel gutter on grid
Applies 20 pixel gutter on grid
Simple footer class
File Input Element wrapper
Image preview of uploaded file
fill the image in an element using width and height of 100%
makes element of 100% height
Responsive font size utility
Allows to place a fixed with responsive sidebar on the right side of the content
Creates an icon. Bootstrap provides 260 free glyphicons from the Glyphicons Halflings set
Adds a red color to the label and a red border to the input, as well as an error icon inside the input (used together with .has-feedback)
Adds feedback icons for inputs (checkmark, warning and error signs)
Adds a green color to the label and a green border to the input, as well as a checkmark icon inside the input (used together with .has-feedback)
Adds a yellow/orange color to the label and a yellow/orange border to the input, as well as a checkmark icon inside the input (used together with .has-feedback)
Allow Footer to be sticky at the bottom of page
A block of help text that breaks onto a new line and may extend beyond one line.
Forces an element to be hidden (display:none)
Hides content depending on screen size
This class is the same as hidden but is deprecated so use .hidden instead
Apply heading styles to other elements. Make a paragraph look like an h1.
Used in the navbar to create a hamburger menu (three horizontal bars)
Unicode icon (arrow pointing right), used in carousels. This is often replaced with a glyphicon
Unicode icon (arrow pointing left), used in carousels. This is often replaced with a glyphicon
Shapes an image to a circle (not supported in IE8 and earlier)
Makes a image responsive. The image resizes with the width of screen. the maximum size of image is always the size resolution of image.
It adds rounded corners to an image.
Shapes an image to a thumbnail (borders)
Fades in tabs
Adds a light-blue background to the table row (<tr> or table cell (<td>). Indicates a neutral informative change or action
Displays the text inside an <abbr> element in a slightly smaller font size
Container to enhance an input by adding an icon, text or a button in front or behind it as a "help text"
input-group-lg class is used for large input group
input-group-sm class is used for small input group
Together with the .input-group class, this class makes it possible to add an icon or help text next to the input field
Together with the .input-group class, this class attaches a button next to an input. Often used as a search bar
Set heights using classes like .input-lg, and set widths using grid column classes like .col-lg-*.
Set heights using classes like .input-lg, and set widths using grid column classes like .col-lg-*.
Makes an element invisible (visibility:hidden). Note: Even though the element is invisible, it will take up space on the page
Class added to each carousel item. May be text or images
Creates a padded grey box with rounded corners that enlarges the font sizes of the text inside it. Creates a big box for calling extra attention to some special content or information
Adds a grey rounded box to an element. Provides additional information about something (e.g. "New")
Change color of the label by adding label-danger class for  Red label.
Change color of the label by adding label-info class for Light-blue label
Change color of the label by adding  label-success class for Green label
Change color of the label by adding label-warning class for Yellow label
Increase the font size and line height of a paragraph. Good to use on the first paragraph of an article to improve readability.
Used to identify the left carousel control
Creates a bordered list group for <li> elements
Added to each <li> element in the list group
Creates a list group heading (used on other elements besides <li>)
Used for item text inside the list group (used on other elements besides <li>)
Red background color for a list item in a list group
Light-blue background color for a list item in a list group
Green background color for a list item in a list group
Yellow background color for a list item in a list group
Places all list items on a single line (horizontal menu)
Removes all default list-style (bullets, left margin, etc.) styling from a <ul> or <ol> list
Highlights text: Highlighted text
For highlighting a run of text due to its relevance in another context, use the mark tag.
Text that should appear next to a media object
Creates a heading inside the media object
Nested media lists would be good used as comments
Aligns media object to Left in comments or news feed
Aligns media object to Right in comments or news feed
Class added to a media component image.
Identifies the content as a modal and brings focus to it
The modal body content class : Header - Body - Footer
Styles the modal (border, background-color, etc). Inside this, add the modals header, body and footer, if needed
Sets the proper width and margin of the modal
The footer of the modal (often contains an action button and a close button)
The header of the modal (often contains a title and a close button)
It makes a model wider or Large modal (wider than default)
Javascript adds this class to the body tag to prevent scrolling with the modal is open.
Makes the modal not as wide or Small modal (less width)
The title of the modal
Helper Class to adjust margin to of navmenu, body or wrapper as per navbar height while using a Fixed Navbar
Helper Class to adjust margin to of navmenu, body or wrapper as per navbar height while using a Bottom Fixed Navbar
Responsive margin at all side of element
Responsive margin at top of element
Responsive margin at right of element
Responsive margin at bottom of element
Responsive margin at left of element
Class added to enable Bootstrap tabs, simply we can say navigation menu.
Indicates a pill menu
Used on a <ul> container that contains the list items with links inside a navigation bar
Centers tabs/pills. Note that on screens smaller than 768px the items are stacked (content will remain centered)
Vertically stack tabs or pills
Creates a navigation header bar.

column2: Brand Text or Logo Class of Navbar
column3: Added to a link or a header element inside the navbar to represent a logo or a header
Vertically aligns a button inside a navbar
Collapses the navbar (hidden and replaced with a menu/hamburger icon on mobile phones and small tablets)
Creates a default navigation bar (light-grey background color)
Makes the navbar stay at the bottom of the screen (sticky/fixed)
Makes the navbar stay at the top of the screen (sticky/fixed)
Added to form elements inside the navbar to vertically center them (proper padding)
Added to a container element that contains the link/element that represent a logo or a header
Creates a black navigation bar (instead of light-grey)
Aligns nav links, forms, buttons, or text, in the navbar to the left

Styles an element to look like a link inside the navbar (anchors get proper padding and an underline on hover, while other elements like p or span gets a default hover effect - white color in an inversed navbar and a black color in a default navbar)
Aligns nav links, forms, buttons, or text in the navbar to the right.
Removes left, top and right borders (rounded corners) from the navbar (default navbar has a gray border and a 4px border-radius by default)
Vertical align any elements inside the navbar that are not links (ensures proper padding)
Styles the button that should open the navbar on small screens. Often used together with three .icon-bar classes to indicate a toggleable menu icon (hamburger/bars)
This class justified tabs and pill in small screen. Justified Tabs is common in apps and similar feature can be used this class
Creates a Vertical Navigation Menu of 240px
Creates a fixed Navigation Menu at left of page. a responsive padding or margin of 240px is required to body or wrapper
Creates a fixed Navigation Menu at Right of page. a responsive padding or margin of 240px is required to body or wrapper
Removes under line for normal, hover and visited states
Allow Container and container fluid navbar to slide in mobile resolution
This class is an alternate to navbar-collapse
Allows to add non responsive navbar item in right.
Created a justified Navbar (like Apple Website). Navbar-brand is not required while using this class on .navbar-nav
Used in the carousel control to identity the next control
Used to align pager buttons to the right side of the page (next button)
Offcanvas helps navbar and Navmenu to slide in
Allow Navmenu toggle at any breakpoint
Common page class
Class designed to support sidebar. It is recommended to use this class on <main> tag
Place content of your page in this wrapper
Creates Sidebar of page of width 240px. This sidebar is of fixed width till small size screen.
Adds a horizontal line under the heading (+ adds some extra space around the element)
class added to a ul which contains li with anchors. Good for previous and next buttons.
Creates a pagination (Useful when you have a web site with lots of pages. Used on <ul> elements)
Large pagination (each pagination link gets a font-size of 18px. Default is 14px)
Small pagination (each pagination link gets a font-size of 12px. Default is 14px)
Change the color of the panel by adding the following: default, primary, info, warning, danger.
Panel body can contain text content and has padding of 15px in all sides. Class added to the panel body because there is also a panel heading.
Collapsible panel (toggle between hiding and showing panel(s))
A default panel contains a grey boreded panel will gray heading
We can change the color of the panel by adding the panel-primary class , Primary theme color. Indicates theme coloured panels
We can change the color of the panel by adding the panel-danger class , Red color. Indicates danger
We can change the color of the panel by adding the panel-info class , Light-blue panel. Indicates information
We can change the color of the panel by adding the panel-success class , Green panel. Indicates success
We can change the color of the panel by adding the panel-warning class , Yellow panel. Indicates warning
Creates a panel footer (light background color)
Used to group many panels together. This removes the bottom margin below each panel
Creates a panel header (light background color)
Used inside a .panel-heading to adjust the styling of the text (removes margins and adds a font-size of 16px)
Makes a <pre> element scrollable (max-height of 350px and provide a y-axis scrollbar)
Used in carousels to indicate a "previous" link
Used to align pager buttons to the left side of the page (previous button)
Container for progress bars, with % indication.
Creates a progress bar
Red progress bar. Indicates danger
Light-blue progress bar. Indicates information
Creates a striped progress bar
Green progress bar. Indicates success
Yellow progress bar. Indicates warning
Float an element to the left, pulling an element to left.
Float an element to the right, its pulling an element to right side.
Helper Class to adjust padding top of navmenu, body or wrapper as per navbar height while using a Fixed Navbar
Helper Class to adjust padding bottom of navmenu, body or wrapper as per navbar height while using a Bottom Fixed Navbar
Responsive padding at all side of element
Responsive padding at top of element
Responsive padding at right of element
Responsive padding at bottom of element
Responsive padding at left of element
Used to identify the right carousel control
Form radio wrapper - Radio are for selecting one from several options in a list.
Arranges radio inline
column13: Checkboxes are for selecting one or several options in a list, while radios are for selecting one option from many.

column3: Container for responsive columns
Converts a normal grid row to flex row

column2: Border split or divider for grid
column3: Divides grid columns by using borders to the right of column. THe borders are responsive and only work when column size is below 12
Used for inline list. The separator is |
Shows an element (display:block)
Creates a lighter, secondary text in any heading
Hides an element on all devices except for screen readers
Hides an element on all devices except for screen readers
Adds a green background color to a table row (<tr> or table cell (<td>). Indicates success or a positive action
Used together with .tab-pane to creates toggleable/dynamic tabs/pills
Used together with .tab-content to creates toggleable/dynamic tabs/pills
Tabs on Left side of the Content
Tabs on Right side of the content
Adds basic styling to a table (padding, bottom borders, etc)
Adds borders on all sides of the table and cells
Makes a table more compact by cutting cell padding in half
add zebra-striping to any table row within the <tbody>
Creates a hoverable table (adds a grey background color on table rows on hover)
Makes a table responsive (adds a horizontal scrollbar when needed)
Indicates capitalized text, this class will allow us to make the text in capital letters.
It aligns our text to center, or Center-aligns text
text-danger class applys red color to text which Indicates danger.
Hides text (helps replace an elements text content with a background image)
Light-blue text color. Indicates information
Indicates justified text
Aligns the text to the left
Changes text to lowercase
text-muted class turns the text to Grey color.
Prevents the text from wrapping
text-primary class turns the text to blue color.
Aligns text to the right
Green text color. Indicates success
Makes text uppercase
Yellow/orange text color. Indicates warning
Supports Center Text Alignment as per breakpoint
Supports Left Text Alignment as per breakpoint
Supports Right Text Alignment as per breakpoint
Adds a border around an element (often images or videos) to make it look like a thumbnail
Utility class to vertical middle align a table-cell, inline block and inline element
Utility class to vertical top align a table-cell, inline block and inline element
Utility class to vertical bottom align a table-cell, inline block and inline element
Deprecated as of v3.2.0. Used to show and/or hide content by device. Note: Use .hidden-* instead
Displays the element (display:block) in print (pre)view
Displays the element (display:inline) in print (pre)view
Displays the element (display:inline-block) in print (pre)view
Hides the element (display:none) in print (pre)view
Adds a yellow background color to the table row (<tr> or table cell (<td>). Indicates a warning
Wells are good for insetting some content. The default styling adds a border box and inner padding.
Wells are good for insetting some content. The default styling adds a border box and inner padding. This class doubles the padding.
Wells are good for insetting some content. The default styling adds a border box and inner padding. This class decreases the padding.
quoting blocks of content from another source within your document.
